page.title: 16CUSTOMS OF DENBIGH
page.content: Recently the 11th Earl has reinstated {DAFFODIL SUNDAY.}The grounds are open to the public for one Sunday in April when the multitude of daffodils are in full bloom.The money raised is donated to two Charities of the Earls choice. Pinch Furlong Wood is so named because a previous Earl 'pinched' the paddock, belonging to the keeper at Keepers Cottage,for planting. During the second World War,fields from Newnham Lodge Farm were used to create a{'Dummy' Coventry Airfield,}& consequently many bombs were dropped here.Whilst ploughing,the present farmer still finds pieces of shrapnel. The stream running through the estate flows into the Oxford canal,but it has no name.At one point it passes under Folly Bridge,which has three small arches & a narrow cattle grid still in place alongside the track.
